system.description:
When sung, this spell-song induces an overwhelming, paranoid fear in all sentient beings within the area of effect, unless they successfully resist the effect.

Effects:

  • Every creature within a 30' x 30' x 30' area must make a saving throw vs. Spells at -2 each round they remain inside.
  • Creatures that succeed on the save each round or leave the area remain unaffected.
  • Creatures that fail a saving throw while in the area instantly become delusional, believing that all nearby beings are enemies.

Frenzied Assault:

  • Delusional victims have a 50% chance each round to attack the nearest person, regardless of friend or foe.
  • Attacks made while in this state gain +1 to hit and +1 to damage (stacking with Strength bonuses).
  • The effect persists even if the victim leaves the area of effect.
  • The frenzy lasts for a number of **hours** equal to the **bard's level**.

Ending the Effect:

  • The frenzy can be removed with remove curse, wish, or any other spell that removes enchantments.

Duration & Risks:

  • The bard may maintain this song for a number of rounds equal to their Constitution score.
  • If the bard continues playing beyond this limit, they must make a saving throw vs. Spells each round or fall under the **same effects** as the victims.
  • The spell-song affects everyone within the area, including the bardâ€™s allies.

Rolls:

  • Frenzied assault chance: [[/r 1d100 #50% chance to attack the nearest person]]
  • Bard's Constitution limit: [[/r @actor.system.abilities.con.value #Rounds the bard can sing safely]]
system.effect: Causes paranoia and frenzied attacks in affected creatures
